definitions: done quickly and without giving sufficient attention to detail or thoroughness
examples: The doctor gave only a cursory examination before diagnosis
Her cursory glance at the report missed important details

definitions: rudely brief in speech or manner; using very few words in an unfriendly way
examples: His curt reply suggested he was angry about something
The receptionist gave a curt nod without looking up

definitions: having a smooth continuous bend or arc rather than angles or straight lines
examples: The curved blade of the sword gleamed in sunlight
She walked along the curved path through the garden

definitions: forming or following a smooth continuous bend or arc; bending gradually
examples: The curving coastline stretched for miles ahead of us
She traced the curving lines with her finger

definitions: having many curves or a curved shape rather than being straight
having an attractively curved figure, especially referring to a woman's body
examples: The curvy mountain road required careful driving
The curvy design of the vase made it unique
She wore a dress that flattered her curvy figure
The fashion industry is becoming more inclusive of curvy models

definitions: having soft padding or cushions for comfort or protection
protected from harsh effects or sudden shocks by something that absorbs impact
examples: The cushioned seat made the long flight more comfortable
His cushioned running shoes reduced stress on his knees
Their savings cushioned them from the economic downturn
The cushioned landing protected the fragile equipment

definitions: relating to the protective care or guardianship of someone or something
relating to imprisonment rather than other forms of punishment
examples: The custodial parent has primary responsibility for the children
The museum has custodial duties for these ancient artifacts
He received a custodial sentence of three years
The judge opted for a custodial rather than community punishment

definitions: made or done to order for a particular customer according to specifications
examples: He drives a custom sports car with unique features
The custom furniture perfectly fit the unusual space

definitions: according to the customs or usual practices associated with a particular society or situation
examples: It's customary to shake hands when meeting someone new
The customary greeting varies from culture to culture

definitions: having been divided, shaped, or removed with a sharp instrument
reduced in amount, size, or extent from a previous level
examples: The cut flowers were arranged in a crystal vase
His cut finger required several stitches
The cut prices attracted many bargain hunters
Their cut budget meant fewer resources for programs

definitions: attractive in a pretty or endearing way, especially small or young
showing cleverness or cunning, especially in a self-satisfied way
examples: The cute puppy wagged its tail enthusiastically
She wore a cute dress to the birthday party
Don't get cute with me about the rules
His cute remarks didn't impress the committee

definitions: fierce and intense in competition; willing to harm others to succeed
examples: The cutthroat business environment destroyed many startups
She thrived in the cutthroat world of investment banking

definitions: having a sharp edge capable of cutting; penetratingly cold
unkindly critical or sarcastic in a way that hurts feelings
examples: The cutting wind made everyone seek shelter indoors
The cutting edge of the knife sliced through easily
Her cutting remarks left him feeling humiliated
His cutting wit often went too far

definitions: of a greenish-blue color, one of the primary colors in color printing
examples: The cyan ink cartridge needs to be replaced soon
She painted the ocean in beautiful cyan tones

definitions: relating to the science of communications and automatic control systems in machines and living things
examples: The cybernetic implants enhanced his physical abilities
She studied cybernetic systems in graduate school

definitions: occurring in cycles or repeated sequences; happening in a regularly repeated order
examples: The cyclic pattern of seasons affects agricultural planning
Economic growth often follows cyclic trends

definitions: occurring in cycles; regularly repeated in the same order over time
examples: The business experiences cyclical fluctuations in demand
Unemployment tends to be cyclical in nature

definitions: relating to or having the characteristics of a cyclone with rotating winds
examples: The cyclonic storm system brought heavy rainfall
Cyclonic winds devastated the coastal region

definitions: having the shape of a cylinder with circular cross-section and straight parallel sides
examples: The cylindrical storage tank holds thousands of gallons
She arranged flowers in a tall cylindrical vase

definitions: believing that people are motivated purely by self-interest; distrustful of human sincerity
examples: His cynical view of politics kept him from voting
She became cynical after years of disappointment

definitions: relating to or characterized by cysts which are sac-like structures
relating to the urinary bladder or gallbladder
examples: The patient was diagnosed with cystic fibrosis
The cystic lesion required immediate medical attention
The cystic duct connects the gallbladder to bile ducts
Cystic stones can cause severe abdominal pain

definitions: relating to or supporting the system of government by czars in imperial Russia
examples: The czarist regime ended with the Russian Revolution
Many czarist policies were abolished after 1917

definitions: marked or spotted with drops or small amounts of liquid or color
examples: The dabbled sunlight filtered through the leaves
Her dabbled painting technique created interesting textures

definitions: silly, foolish, or stupid; lacking good sense or judgment
examples: That's a daft idea that will never work
Don't be daft about spending all your savings

definitions: delicately small and pretty; showing delicate or careful precision
showing or requiring fastidious refinement in taste or manners
examples: She took dainty bites of the wedding cake
The dainty teacup had a floral pattern
Her dainty manners impressed the dinner guests
He was too dainty to enjoy camping outdoors

definitions: harmed or injured physically so as to be impaired in function or value
examples: The damaged goods were sold at a discount
Her damaged reputation never fully recovered

definitions: causing physical harm or having a detrimental effect on someone or something
examples: The damaging effects of pollution are well documented
His damaging testimony hurt the defendant's case

definitions: made of or resembling damask fabric with elaborate woven patterns
examples: The damask tablecloth added elegance to the dining room
She chose damask curtains for the formal parlor

definitions: used for emphasis to express annoyance or frustration; deserving condemnation
examples: That damn car won't start again this morning
It's a damn shame that project was cancelled

definitions: condemned to eternal punishment; under a curse
used to emphasize or express anger, frustration, or amazement
examples: The damned souls wandered through the underworld
Medieval paintings often depicted the damned in hell
That damned machine never works properly
She did a damned good job on the presentation

definitions: strongly suggesting guilt or error; extremely critical or condemning
examples: The damning evidence sealed the defendant's fate
The report contained damning criticism of management

definitions: slightly wet, typically in a way that is unpleasant or uncomfortable
examples: The damp towel smelled musty after three days
His damp clothes clung uncomfortably to his skin

definitions: having a rhythm or beat that makes it suitable or easy to dance to
examples: The band played danceable tunes all night long
This track is incredibly danceable with its strong beat

definitions: excellent, fine, or first-rate; very good in quality or condition
examples: Everything's just dandy now that the problem's solved
That's a dandy solution to our scheduling conflict

definitions: able or likely to cause harm, injury, or death; involving risk or danger
examples: Swimming in dangerous waters requires extreme caution
His dangerous driving led to several near accidents

definitions: unpleasantly damp and cold, typically with a musty smell
examples: The dank basement needed better ventilation
A dank mist rose from the swampy ground

definitions: neat and trim in dress and appearance; stylishly and carefully dressed
examples: The dapper gentleman wore a perfectly tailored suit
He always looked dapper in his vintage clothing

definitions: recklessly bold or daring; showing a willingness to take dangerous risks
examples: His daredevil stunts thrilled the circus audience
The daredevil pilot performed dangerous aerial maneuvers

definitions: adventurously bold; showing a willingness to take risks or attempt difficult things
examples: Her daring rescue saved three children from drowning
The artist's daring use of color shocked critics

definitions: with little or no light; not able to be seen through
of a deep or intense color, especially approaching black
suggestive of or arising from evil characteristics or forces; gloomy
examples: The dark room made it hard to find anything
It gets dark early in winter months
She wore a dark blue dress to the reception
His dark hair contrasted with pale skin
The movie explored the dark side of human nature
These were dark days for the company

definitions: made dark or darker; having reduced light or deepened in color
examples: The darkened theater prepared audiences for the show
His darkened mood worried his friends

definitions: becoming progressively darker in light or color; threatening or ominous
examples: The darkening sky signaled an approaching storm
His darkening expression showed growing anger

definitions: dearly loved or regarded with deep affection
charming, delightful, or attractive in an endearing way
examples: Her darling daughter just graduated from college
He was grandmother's darling grandson
That's a darling little cottage by the lake
She wore the most darling dress to the party

definitions: disappointed or discouraged; having hopes or expectations suddenly destroyed
examples: His dashed hopes left him feeling depressed
Their dashed dreams of success haunted them

definitions: attractive in a romantic, adventurous way; spirited and stylish in appearance
examples: The dashing hero rescued the princess from danger
He looked dashing in his military uniform

definitions: wicked and cruel in a cowardly way; showing despicable cowardice
examples: The villain's dastardly plot was finally exposed
Such dastardly behavior deserves severe punishment

definitions: able to be assigned to a particular date or time period
examples: The datable artifacts helped establish the site's age
These datable documents prove the timeline of events

definitions: old-fashioned or out of date; showing the style of a past period
examples: The dated decor made the house hard to sell
His dated references revealed his age

definitions: seeming difficult to deal with in prospect; intimidating or discouraging through size or difficulty
examples: The daunting task of climbing Everest deterred many
Starting a new business can be daunting

definitions: showing fearlessness and determination; not intimidated or discouraged by difficulty
examples: The dauntless explorer ventured into uncharted territory
Her dauntless spirit inspired the entire team
